alert.note: Alert for Coastal Franklin; Coastal Gulf; Inland Franklin; Inland Gulf (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 2:56PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Gulf and western Franklin Counties through 330 PM EDT/230 PM CDT/... At 256 PM EDT/156 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles south of Wewahitchka to near Port St. Joe to 16 miles west of Apalachicola to 24 miles south of Mexico Beach. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... St George Island, Eastpoint, Apalachicola, Franklin, Nine Mile, Buck Siding, Royal Bluff, High Bluff, Eleven Mile, St George Island St Pk, Thirteen Mile, Odena, Cape San Blas, Indian Pass, Tilton, Beverly, Green Point, Bay City, Howard Creek and Willis Landing. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT/500 PM CDT/ for Big Bend of and the Panhandle of Florida.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Franklin; Coastal Gulf; Inland Franklin; Inland Gulf
